1:
Hear my voice, God, listen to my complaint;\q preserve my life from fear of my enemies.
\q
2:
Hide me from the secret plotting of evildoers,\q from the commotion of the doers of iniquity.


\q
3:
They have sharpened their tongues like swords;\q they have aimed their arrows, bitter words,
\q
4:
so that they may shoot from secret places at someone who is innocent;\q suddenly they shoot at him and fear nothing.


\q
6:
They invent sinful plans;\q "We have finished," they say, "a careful plan."
\q The inner thoughts and hearts of man are deep.


\q
7:
But God will shoot them;\q suddenly they will be wounded with his arrows.
\q
8:
They will be made to stumble, since their own tongues are against them;\q all who see them will wag their heads.
\q
9:
All people will fear\q and will declare God's deeds.
\q They will wisely think about what he has done.


\q
10: The righteous will be glad about Yahweh and will take refuge in him;\q all the upright in heart will take pride in him.
